choices: Check the hole in the wall
1.content:
You wake up after being in a daze.
You don't know where you are and how you got there.
Your head is aching like a bitch and the only thing you see is a corridor and the floor that you were on.
"Urgh, where the fuck am I," you say question yourself.
You stand up and almost fall due to being lightheaded.
In front of you there are stairs, a door leading to the basement, and another door leading to the kitchen.
Behind you is the door to outside.
There is also a hole in the wall the catches your attention.

What do you plan on doing?
1.title: The house

14.content:
You look behind you to see a door leading outside.
"No,... this is-. This is too easy," you say to yourself.
You're giving second thoughts of trusting this door.
Then suddenly you hear a noise.
This was noise sounded like a growl from the lower levels.
The growl was not of anything human nor animal.
"Oh, fuck it," you say with a trembling fear in your voice.
You run to the door and grasp the doorknob with a tense grip.
Footsteps are then heard from afar, you don't know where they're coming from.
With your heart pounding like a hammer, you jiggle the doorknob but it seems to be locked.
You can't find the keyhole, meaning that the door is locked from the outside.
You're trapped.
Your options are limited and your survival is almost slim.
What will you do?
14.title: Try to leave

choices: Try to hide in the darkness
141.content:
"DAMMIT," you shout within your thoughts.
Someone or something is coming your way.
A stench of rotten flesh is reaching your nostrils.
You have nothing to defend yourself with.
The only thing for you to do is hide.

Where will you hide.
141.title: Find a place to hide.

info.brief_description: You wake up in an old house, you don't where you are. Find why you're there and survive.
info.description:
This is an attempt at a horror/survival interactive story.
The main character can die, but his death has to make sense and he can't die at an early point of the story.
Try to make this as scary as possible.
Don't add any type of nonsense/
Try to stick to the story.
